item.title: Lily add a quote by Rob Sheffield
item.description:
"on the 11th of every month my friend elizabeth would say, "well we made it through another month. so do we get her back now?" we always giggled, but we really did expect to get her back. its not human to let go of love, even when it's dead.
we expected one of these monthly anniversaries to be the Final Goodbye. we figured that we'd said all our goodbyes, and given up all the tears we had to give. we'd passed the test and would get back what we'd lost. but instead, every anniversary hurt more, and every anniversary felt like she was further away from coming back. the idea that there wouldn't be a final goodbye- that was a hard goodbye in itself and, at that point, still an impossible goodbye. no private eye has to tell you it's a long goodbye.
...the loss just doesn't go away- it gets bigger the longer you look at it." -- Rob Sheffield

item.title: Lily add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Lily add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "That's how a thing starts out real then ends up just an idea." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Lily add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Lily add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "This was not a faerie tale. This was not the movies. This was life. It hurt more. It was excruciating. It was excruciatingly beautiful." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Lily add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is sometimes extraordinarily, passionately, in love with suffering..." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Lily add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "As for me, I am a watercolor. I wash off." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Lily add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Lily add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Lily add a quote by Arthur Phillips
item.description: "All of this vain heartbreak that we cling to as important or tragic would one day be revealed - by TV scientists - for what it is: just behavior." -- Arthur Phillips

item.title: Lily add a quote by Arthur Phillips
item.description: "How much of life could he spend aching? Aching is not a stable condition; it must resolve into something" -- Arthur Phillips

item.title: Lily add a quote by Martin Luther King, Jr.
item.description: "Only in the darkness can you see the stars." -- Martin Luther King, Jr.

item.title: Lily add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I have decided to stick to love...Hate is too great a burden to bear." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lily add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I know why we try to keep the dead alive: we try to keep them alive in order to keep them with us. I also know that if we are to live ourselves there comes a point at which we must relinquish the dead, let them go, keep them dead. " -- Joan Didion

item.title: Lily add a quote by Wil Wheaton
item.description: "Be honest. Be kind. Be honorable. Work hard. And always be awesome." -- Wil Wheaton
